properties.name: Auschwitz concentration camp
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Krakow, PolandAuschwitz was the German armys largest concentration camp during World War 2. It consisted of three parts; administrative center, extermination camp, and work camp. Auschwitz also had over 40 branching camps that held to a dozen to a thousand of prisoners. 2.5 million people were killed here and 90 percent were Jews. Auschwitz was a awful place. I recently got a chance to study this place. Its awful! Some of the things I learned were horrifying. How could somebody treat a human being like that? This place helps us remember the millions lost.

properties.name: Battle of Gettysburg
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Gettysburg, Pennsylvania The Battle of Gettysburg was fought from July 1- July 3, 1863. the war was between the Union and the Confederacy. It was also the battle with the most casualties, between 48,000 American deaths. In the end the union one and the Confederacy fell. Later on President Lincoln gave his famous Gettysburg Address in honor of all the deaths.

properties.name: Brevard NC
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123brevard ncBrevard, North Carolina is an amzing place. Close to the blue Ridge and Pisgah National Forest its an amazing vacation spots. Brevard is home to many animals bears and deer but also the white squirrel. They run all over in Brevard. Brevards downtown is an awesome place to walk, eat, and shop. With all of its small quant shops it makes it perfect. Pisgah National Forest is located in Brevard. Pisgah is unreal. Its covered in waterfalls, nature, swimming, and fun. Pisgah holds Sliding Rock which is a natuarl water slide and so much fu. Its perfect for a sunny day.

properties.name: Christ the Redeemer
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Rio de JaneiroChrist the Redeemer is a huge statue located on the top of the Corcovado Mountains in Brazil. It is 700 tons and 130 feet tall. It is made ouut of concrete. It symbolizes Christianity. Construction took nine years and was unvailed on October 12, 1931. It cost 50,000 and was constructed by Paul Landowski. Christ the Redeemer statue is amazing and a place where you should definatly visit.

properties.name: Clock Tower
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Westminster, LondonBig Ben is the worlds largest four-faced, chiming clock. It was constructed in 1858 and stands 316 feet high. Its a big cultural reference to London and the UK because its so well known. Its often used in movies to give the location of the scene. Its bel inside is wieghs tons and has been in use since the beginning.

properties.name: Colosseum
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123The Colosseum, formally the Flavian Amphitheatre, is a huge amphitheatre located in the heart of Rome, Italy. Built in 80AD it was one of Roman engineerings greatest works. The Colosseum was used for battles, animal hunts, executions, and dramas. It could hold 50,000 spectators. This amazing structure entertained for 500 years.

properties.name: Great Pyramid of Giza
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Cairo, EgyptThe Great Pyramid of Giza is the Seventh Wonder of the Ancient World. It was built around 2570 BC. Inside the great pyramid holds three chambers that house the tombs of ancient kings and queens. The pyramid was made by all man power they used blocks from quarrys and dragged and lifted the huge blocks into place. Its an amazing structure and definatly worth going to see!!

properties.name: Madagascar
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123Madagascar is the worlds fourth biggest island. It homes 5 percent of the worlds animal species and 80 percent only found on the island. Its a beautiful place. Madagascar is a place with many different climates ranging from rain forests to deserts. This island produces many goods such as coffee, vanilla, bananas, and cocoa. Also a movie called Madagascar came out and it was awesome!

properties.name: Wake Forest University
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123 Winston Salem NCGO DEACS!!! Wake Forest University is located in Winston-Salem, NC. Wake Forest was named in 1839 by Dr. Samuel Wait, a baptist minister. Wake Forest grew and grew and now is a big college. Wake is known for its academics offering 34 majors. Its on eof the top and prestiges schools in the country. This past November I got the privalige to visit the beautiful campus and watch the deacs play NC State and stomp them into the ground!! It was awesome! Its beautiful up there and I really want to attend college there. GO WAKE!!!!

properties.name: Yosemite National Park
properties.description: Posted by Mayday123 Yosemite National ParkYosemite National Park is located in California. It covers 761,266 acres. Yosemite is visited by over 3.5 million people a year. Yosemite is home to a large number of different plants and wildlife, such as Giant Sequia trees. Yosemite has over 250 different species of verebrates. American Black Bear, Bobcat, Gray Fox, Mule deer, Mountain Kingsnake, Gilbert\'s Skink, White-headed Woodpecker, Brown Creeper, Spotted Owl, And different types of bats are some of the animals that live here. Its a amazing natural attraction God made for you to enjoy.
